Generation V.Black: It can manipulate an opponent's memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.
Generation V.White: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.
Generation V.Black 2: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.
Generation V.White 2: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.

Generation VI.X: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.
Generation VI.Y: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: With its psychic powers, it rewrites its opponents' memories. You, too, may have already had your memories rewritten.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It has strong psychic powers. Using its fingers that flash three different colors, it controls its opponents and rewrites their memories.

Generation VIII.Sword: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.
Generation VIII.Shield: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.

Generation VIII.Sword: Lake of Outrage Bridge Field ( Wanderer )
Generation VIII.Shield: Lake of Outrage Bridge Field ( Wanderer )
